editions.name: WCAG 2.1 Level AA
editions.description: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.1 Level AA conformance

editions.name: WCAG 2.2 Level AA
editions.description: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2 Level AA conformance

criteria.name: Non-text Content
criteria.description: All non-text content has a text alternative

criteria.name: Audio-only and Video-only
criteria.description: Alternatives for time-based media

criteria.name: Captions (Prerecorded)
criteria.description: Captions provided for prerecorded audio

criteria.name: Audio Description or Media Alternative
criteria.description: Audio description or alternative provided

criteria.name: Captions (Live)
criteria.description: Captions provided for live audio

criteria.name: Audio Description (Prerecorded)
criteria.description: Audio description provided for video

criteria.name: Info and Relationships
criteria.description: Information and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined

criteria.name: Meaningful Sequence
criteria.description: Reading sequence is programmatically determinable

criteria.name: Sensory Characteristics
criteria.description: Instructions do not rely solely on sensory characteristics

criteria.name: Orientation
criteria.description: Content not restricted to a single display orientation

criteria.name: Identify Input Purpose
criteria.description: Input purpose can be programmatically determined

criteria.name: Use of Color
criteria.description: Color is not the only visual means of conveying information

criteria.name: Audio Control
criteria.description: Mechanism to pause or control audio

criteria.name: Contrast (Minimum)
criteria.description: Minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1

criteria.name: Resize Text
criteria.description: Text can be resized up to 200%

criteria.name: Images of Text
criteria.description: Use text instead of images of text

criteria.name: Reflow
criteria.description: Content can be presented without loss of information

criteria.name: Non-text Contrast
criteria.description: UI components have contrast ratio of 3:1

criteria.name: Text Spacing
criteria.description: No loss of content with text spacing adjustments

criteria.name: Content on Hover or Focus
criteria.description: Additional content triggered by hover or focus is dismissible

criteria.name: Keyboard
criteria.description: All functionality available from keyboard

criteria.name: No Keyboard Trap
criteria.description: Keyboard focus can be moved away from any component

criteria.name: Character Key Shortcuts
criteria.description: Character key shortcuts can be turned off or remapped

criteria.name: Timing Adjustable
criteria.description: Time limits can be adjusted

criteria.name: Pause, Stop, Hide
criteria.description: Moving content can be paused, stopped, or hidden

criteria.name: Three Flashes or Below Threshold
criteria.description: Pages do not contain content that flashes more than 3 times per second

criteria.name: Bypass Blocks
criteria.description: Mechanism to bypass blocks of content

criteria.name: Page Titled
criteria.description: Pages have descriptive titles

criteria.name: Focus Order
criteria.description: Focus order preserves meaning and operability

criteria.name: Link Purpose (In Context)
criteria.description: Link purpose can be determined from link text and context

criteria.name: Multiple Ways
criteria.description: More than one way to locate a page

criteria.name: Headings and Labels
criteria.description: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose

criteria.name: Focus Visible
criteria.description: Keyboard focus indicator is visible

criteria.name: Focus Not Obscured (Minimum)
criteria.description: Focused component is not entirely hidden

criteria.name: Pointer Gestures
criteria.description: Multipoint gestures have single-pointer alternatives

criteria.name: Pointer Cancellation
criteria.description: Functions activated by pointer can be cancelled

criteria.name: Label in Name
criteria.description: Visible labels are included in accessible names

criteria.name: Motion Actuation
criteria.description: Motion-triggered functions have alternatives

criteria.name: Dragging Movements
criteria.description: Dragging movements have single-pointer alternatives

criteria.name: Target Size (Minimum)
criteria.description: Targets have minimum size of 24x24 CSS pixels

criteria.name: Language of Page
criteria.description: Default human language can be programmatically determined

criteria.name: Language of Parts
criteria.description: Language of passages can be programmatically determined

criteria.name: On Focus
criteria.description: Focus does not cause unexpected context changes

criteria.name: On Input
criteria.description: Input does not cause unexpected context changes

criteria.name: Consistent Navigation
criteria.description: Navigation mechanisms are consistent

criteria.name: Consistent Identification
criteria.description: Components with same functionality are identified consistently

criteria.name: Consistent Help
criteria.description: Help mechanisms are consistent

criteria.name: Error Identification
criteria.description: Input errors are identified and described

criteria.name: Labels or Instructions
criteria.description: Labels or instructions provided for user input

criteria.name: Error Suggestion
criteria.description: Suggestions provided for fixing errors

criteria.name: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
criteria.description: Submissions can be reviewed and corrected

criteria.name: Redundant Entry
criteria.description: Previously entered information is auto-populated

criteria.name: Accessible Authentication (Minimum)
criteria.description: Cognitive function tests not required for authentication

criteria.name: Parsing
criteria.description: Content can be parsed

criteria.name: Name, Role, Value
criteria.description: UI components have programmatic name, role, and value

criteria.name: Status Messages
criteria.description: Status messages can be presented to users by assistive technologies

criteria.name: Accessibility Metadata
criteria.description: EPUB includes required accessibility metadata

criteria.name: Access Modes
criteria.description: accessMode property is specified

criteria.name: Access Mode Sufficient
criteria.description: accessModeSufficient property is specified

criteria.name: Navigation Document
criteria.description: EPUB contains a navigation document

criteria.name: Table of Contents
criteria.description: Navigation document contains a table of contents

criteria.name: EPUB Type Attribute
criteria.description: Structural elements use epub:type

criteria.name: ARIA Roles
criteria.description: Interactive elements use appropriate ARIA roles

criteria.name: Semantic Structure
criteria.description: Document uses semantic HTML structure

criteria.name: Image Alt Text
criteria.description: Images have alternative text

criteria.name: Complex Images
criteria.description: Complex images have extended descriptions

criteria.name: Text Content
criteria.description: Text content is accessible

criteria.name: Reading Order
criteria.description: Reading order is logical

criteria.name: Language Specification
criteria.description: Document language is specified

criteria.name: Heading Structure
criteria.description: Headings are properly structured

criteria.name: List Structure
criteria.description: Lists use proper markup

criteria.name: TOC Completeness
criteria.description: Table of contents is complete

criteria.name: TOC Accuracy
criteria.description: Table of contents links are accurate

criteria.name: Link Accessibility
criteria.description: Links are accessible and descriptive

criteria.name: Page Navigation
criteria.description: Page navigation list is provided

criteria.name: MathML Accessibility
criteria.description: Mathematical content uses MathML
